body: Thanks @HeartSaVioR. Good idea, I'll have a look at the topology classes in storm-starter. Just came across the (StormRunner)[https://github.com/apache/storm/blob/master/examples/storm-starter/src/jvm/org/apache/storm/starter/util/StormRunner.java] class, which the ConfigurableTopology could replace.
@redsanket I'd really appreciated it if you can take a look. Thanks in advance.
@HeartSaVioR I removed StormRunner and modified some of the topologies so that they extend ConfigurableTopology. Please let me know your thoughts on this.

@jnioche 
Could you also modify README.md on storm-starter to apply the change for topologies? Looks great otherwise.
It was two jdk8 annotations that I didn't remove as part of rework/upmerging.  I'll get them
@HeartSaVioR I removed the unneeded annotation and rebuilt with JDK7
I made a mess with this branch and have pushed a clean, squashed PR as a replacement -> #1907
@roshannaik not sure if we can cherry-pick this into master. Do you want to open another PR against master?

Thanks for reviewing.  Here is the PR for master branch ... 
https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1908
@liurenjie1024  thanks for the details. +1.

@liu-zhaokun we shouldn't be removing authorize methods. For UI to work in secure mode you need to go through the configuration section here https://github.com/apache/storm/blob/master/SECURITY.md#uilogviewer . This is not a issue. -1.

kabhwan:

Merged into master and 1.x branch via Harsha.

I would not port back this to 1.0.x branch while release vote for 1.0.3 RC1 is going ahead. I'll take it after vote ends.
+1 Given that it's identical to #1898 we don't need to wait for 24hr.

@ernisv 
Could you squash your commits into one? 
`STORM-2296 Kafka spout no dup on leader changes` would be sufficient to new commit title, and you can describe current commits' titles to the body.

I can handle it if you mind, but then you need to close this PR manually after merging, since Github auto-close doesn't work against non-master branch.

srdo:

These issues were pointed out here http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/storm-dev/201702.mbox/%3C3E125946-CB8B-4FA9-8943-CB5AF367F92B%40coviam.com%3E
It looks like Fields has an equals() now to do this https://github.com/apache/storm/blob/1.x-branch/storm-core/src/jvm/org/apache/storm/tuple/Fields.java
@harshach I should add this to master branch as well, right ?

@harshach @HeartSaVioR I believe I have addressed all your review comments. I temporarily left one commit just with the code review diff. I will squash it once we agree the patch is good to go. Can you please do one last pass. Thanks.
@HeartSaVioR do you mean each README of each module should have a section on how to run the JAR, and the main for that JAR? I agree with that. Perhaps I could file a follow-up JIRA for that.

vesense:

Thanks Tibor Kiss Merged into 1.0.x-branch and 1.x-branch.
@harshach as requested, this is the 1.x-branch version of the patch merged into master
thanks @srdo let me re pr

I'm a little unsure about whether the time unit change to Timer is a good idea. It might be better to either implement nanotime support in Storm Time, or to make the constructor parameters just be in milliseconds (I'm not sure how useful nano/microsecond support is for anyone). Anyone have any opinions on this?

I think it would be best if we merged maxPollOffsets and maxUncommittedOffsets, since having them be different has some undesirable side effects. @hmcl do you have an opinion.

Also this drops support for Kafka 0.9 in KafkaSpoutConfig, since I believe https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/1556 already means that this release won't work with 0.9.

kabhwan:

Thanks for reporting. STORM-2335 already handles this issue.
We may include the fix for 1.0.3 or not, but we will include the fix for 1.1.0.
+1 Thanks for finding and fixing this.

This also changes the exponential backoff formula from currentTime + delayPeriod^(failCount-1) to currentTime + delayPeriod*2^(failCount-1). Multiplying the delay by itself causes the delay to grow extremely quickly, and probably wasn't intended.

It might make sense to add jitter to the backoff as well.

tibor.kiss@gmail.com:

Robert Joseph Evans: Wondering what's your opinion of this approach?

revans2:

Tibor Kiss,

+1. The majority of the code for the worker launcher was borrowed from Hadoop's container launcher, simply because it was battle tested. As such I don't understand all of the original reasoning for what is in the code, but your reasoning seems fine to me and would add in a good feature.
